Public NotInheritable Class SwitchExpression Inherits Expression
public ref class SwitchExpression sealed : System::Linq::Expressions::Expression

Docs.summary: Represents a control expression that handles multiple selections by passing control to .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create an expression that represents a switch statement that has a default case by using the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.Switch%2A> method.
[!code-csharp[System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionDev10#35](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.linq.expressions.expressiondev10/cs/program.cs#35)] [!code-vb[System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionDev10#35](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.linq.expressions.expressiondev10/vb/module1.vb#35)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children. If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.
Docs.returns: This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
